popularityCurve.label: the vast expanses of glaciers massed on average 1 6 miles deep contain enough water to raise sea levels worldwide by 23 feet should they melt or otherwise slip into the ocean they would flood coastal capitals submerge tropical islands and generally redraw the world's atlases the infusion of fresh water could slow or shut down the ocean's currents plunging europe into bitter winter
